item.title: 'Tactical problem' limiting Loftus-Cheek's Chelsea appearances, says Sarri
item.description: Chelsea manager Maurizio Sarri admits he has a "tactical problem" and is struggling to fit Ruben Loftus-Cheek into the side

item.title: Spurs to end Man City's unbeaten start? Lawro's predictions v Richard Ashcroft
item.description: BBC Sport football pundit Mark Lawrenson takes on singer Richard Ashcroft to predict this weekend's Premier League results.

item.title: 'Their goalscoring is frightening' - Can Dortmund end Bayern's reign?
item.description: Borussia Dortmund have had an electrifying start to the season with 37 goals in 12 games. Is this their season?

item.title: Welbeck scores in Lisbon as Arsenal extend winning run to 11 games
item.description: Danny Welbeck's second-half winner gives Arsenal victory over Sporting Lisbon in Portugal, as they retain their place at the top of Europa League Group E.

item.title: Four wins & five clean sheets in 19 - Celtic's dismal European away form analysed
item.description: Brendan Rodgers' European record as Celtic manager does not make for good reading. But what do the statistics say? And what do the pundits think?

item.title: 'Difficult to sleep' after loss - Milan boss Gattuso says job is on the line
item.description: AC Milan boss Gennaro Gattuso accepts his job should be debated after a "terrible, embarrassing performance" against Real Betis.

item.title: Ex-Man Utd striker Dublin 'racially abused by woman'
item.description: The ex-footballer and TV presenter says the abuse isn't "acceptable in 2018".

item.title: Guardiola: The six songs that define my life, love, football and family
item.description: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola speaks exclusively & in depth with BBC Radio 5 live about his life, career and favourite music.

item.title: Progress from group more important than record - Gerrard
item.description: Rangers manager Steven Gerrard says progressing from their Europa League group is more important than their new 11-game unbeaten record.

item.title: Bolt has a first touch like a trampoline - ex-Republic striker Keogh
item.description: Usain Bolt's first touch is "like a trampoline" and he will never make it as a footballer, says former Republic of Ireland striker Andy Keogh.

item.title: Pick Salah and ditch De Gea? Fantasy football tips
item.description: Will Mohamed Salah bring home the points again? And is it time to ditch David de Gea? Here are this week's fantasy football tips.

item.title: Gossip: Real Madrid to make another move for Pochettino
item.description: Pochettino linked with Real Madrid, Manchester United fear losing De Gea, Liverpool open contract talks with Gomez, plus more.

item.title: Rodgers confident Celtic can beat Leipzig at home
item.description: Beating RB Leizpig at home is "within Celtic's capabilities" and is a must if they are to progress in the Europa League, says manager Brendan Rodgers.

item.title: El Clasico: Lionel Messi & Cristiano Ronaldo absent - who can light up El Clasico?
item.description: Real Madrid have no Ronaldo and no goals, Barcelona have no Messi - so how will El Clasico look without its modern superstars?

item.title: 'The best Austrian since Alaba' - Euro Leagues podcast team on Lazaro
item.description: Valentino Lazaro's start to the season since changing position for Hertha Berlin has seen him catch the eye.

item.title: Football Focus: Worst moment of my career - Luka Milivojevic talks penalty misses
item.description: Crystal Palace midfielder Luka Milivojevic chats to Football Focus about feeling guilty after missing a penalty against Everton.

item.title: Pep Guardiola: One of my dreams is to see Elton John live - Man City manager
item.description: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola says one of his dreams is to see Elton John perform live in concert.

item.title: Manchester United 0-1 Juventus: Romelu Lukaku's moment is not sweet - Jose Mourinho
item.description: Manchester United manager Jose Mourinho says Romelu Lukaku is lacking in confidence but "the goals will arrive" for the Belgium international striker.

item.title: 'I will be Mancunian for the rest of my life' - Guardiola
item.description: Pep Guardiola says "it would not be possible to train another team in England like Manchester City."

item.title: My family was at the Manchester Arena the night of the attack - Pep Guardiola
item.description: Pep Guardiola's wife and two daughters were at the Ariana Grande concert at Manchester Arena the night a bomb was detonated on 22 May 2017.

item.title: Can you name the English players to have started for non-British clubs in the Champions League?
item.description: Can you name the English players to have started in the Champions League for non-British clubs?

item.title: Marcelo Brozovic: Inter Milan midfielder hides behind wall to stop Luis Suarez free-kick
item.description: Inter Milan midfielder Marcelo Brozovic has an ingenious idea to stop a Luis Suarez free-kick, by lying down behind the wall... and it worked.

item.title: Man Utd 0-1 Juventus: Why Juve can win the Champions League, and Man Utd won't - Phil Neville analysis
item.description: Manchester United lack the quality they need to beat the best in Europe says ex-defender Phil Neville, but Juventus have everything they need to be successful

item.title: Purplebricks co-founder will write blank cheque to bring 'Champions League music' to Larne
item.description: How the takeover of Larne FC by Purplebricks co-founder Kenny Bruce could be one of Northern Irish football's biggest stories in decades.

item.title: A nine-day journey on a tractor and 48-hour stints in a bunker - the two-time refugee facing Liverpool
item.description: As Red Star Belgrade prepare to take on Liverpool, this is the remarkable story of their defender Milos Degenek, who was made a refugee twice by the age of six.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - October 2018
item.description: Track the managerial ins and outs and a list of every boss in the top five leagues in England and the Scottish Premiership.

item.title: Transfers - done deals between September and December 2018
item.description: Track all the latest signings as they happen in England, Scotland and across the world.

item.title: Notifications, Live Guide, MySport and social media with BBC Sport
item.description: With latest scores and headlines sent straight to your device, personalisation and much more, ensure you have a great sporting life with BBC Sport.
